ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely recommend. It is a must have for any graduate student with any work related to statistics or econometrics. I hope professor Andrews keep teaching it for a long time.
Depends on the student and their needs. The course doesn't teach you anything about how to apply econometrics to the real world.
It is a very helpful course to understand probability theory and the foundations of econometrics and its asypmtotic results.
i would recommend this course since is a nice way to review the basic econometrics in a mathematical formal framework.
- I would recommend it if they are interested in metric theory
It is difficult mathematically, but the material is very interesting.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Very important course for my research work. I plan to use econometrics as the main tool of my research project so this course was essential.
Good mixture of theory and practice
A lot. I want to be an economist.
Good preparation for the actual metrics courses in later semesters.
It has helped me to connect the points of the econometric knowledge I had from previous study. I think this course will be very useful for my future research
- Gave me a good theoretical foundation which will help me approach more technical problems in my area of research
This class piques my interest in econometrics, for the first time.
